committees.committee: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Housing and Community Opportunity

official_title: A bill to provide technical corrections to the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996, to improve the delivery of housing assistance to Indian tribes in a manner that recognizes the right of tribal self-governance, and for other purposes.
short_title: Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act Amendments of 2000

summary.text: Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act Amendments of 2000 - Makes amendments to the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 (NAHASDA), including: (1) setting forth a requirement for assistance to Indian families that are not low-income; (2) eliminating separate Indian housing plan requirements for small Indian tribes; (3) exempting any contract or agreement for assistance, sale, or lease from the requirement that no less than the prevailing wages in the locality be paid to certain workers employed in the development and operation of affordable housing projects if such contract or agreement is otherwise covered by one or more laws or regulations adopted by an Indian tribe that requires the payment of no less than prevailing wages; (4) allowing the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development to waive, in limited circumstances, the requirements pertaining to environmental review; (5) revising provisions regarding review and audit by the Secretary; (6) prescribing an allocation formula for certain Indian tribes; (7) excepting from the hearing requirement certain actions by the Secretary affecting grant amounts if the Secretary makes a determination that the failure of a recipient of assistance to comply substantially with any material provision of the Act is resulting, and would continue to result, in a continuing unauthorized expenditure of Federal funds; and (8) revising requirements regarding noncompliance by recipients because of technical incapacity to permit the provision of technical assistance if the recipient enters into a performance agreement with the Secretary (limits the period of such an agreement to one year).(Sec. 11) Amends NAHASDA to repeal the requirement regarding the certification of compliance with subsidy layering requirements with respect to housing assisted with grant amounts provided under the Act.

titles.title: Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act Amendments of 1999
Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act Amendments of 1999
Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act Amendments of 2000

A bill to provide technical corrections to the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996, to improve the delivery of housing assistance to Indian tribes in a manner that recognizes the right of tribal self-governance, and for other purposes.
